page.title: 10ROBSON'S FARM, HOPTON
page.content: Robson's Farm is owned by Mr. Capon. The farm is over 100 years old. It is quite a small farm with a few cows, calves, geese and chickens. The farm has 80 acres altogether. The cows are milked twice a day and there is one tank in the dairy. In the morning the farmer's duty starts at about 6.30am. and he mostly always feeds the animals before his breakfast. The worst trouble on the farm was the gales. The farmer works on his own but his son helps him sometimes. On the farm they grow oats, barley, sugar beet and grass for feed for the cows. There are two tractors. Mr. Capon enjoys his work on the farm.
